recipes.title: Garlicky Chicken With Lemon-Anchovy Sauce
ingredients: 1¼ pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs (4 to 5 thighs)
steps: Heat oven to 350°F. Season chicken thighs with salt and pepper. Mince one garlic clove and reserve. In an ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat, warm the olive oil, then add the five smashed garlic cloves, anchovies, capers, and chile flakes. Cook 3 to 5 minutes, stirring to break up the anchovies, until the garlic browns and the anchovies dissolve.
Add the chicken thighs and sear until well browned on one side, 5 to 7 minutes. Flip the thighs, transfer the skillet to the oven, and roast 5 to 10 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through.

Transfer chicken to a plate. Return the skillet to the stove, add the reserved minced garlic and juice from half the lemon, and cook about 30 seconds while scraping up browned bits. Return the chicken to the pan and cook in the sauce for another 15 to 30 seconds. Transfer to a platter, squeeze the remaining lemon half over the top, garnish with chopped parsley, and serve.

recipes.title: Honey lime chicken bowl
steps: tsp salt
/2 tsp black pepper
tsp paprika
tsp onion powder
/2 tsp dried oregano For the Bowls:
cup fire-roasted corn (you can use frozen and thawed or canned)
cucumber, thinly sliced (use raw or pickled, per preference)
/2 red onion, thinly sliced (use raw or pickled, per preference) Lime wedges, for serving Fresh cilantro, chopped (optional)
Marinate the Chicken:

In a bowl, whisk together liquid aminos, honey, lime juice, and minced garlic. Add the chicken thighs to the marinade, making sure they are fully coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours for more flavor.
Cook the Chicken:
Preheat a skillet or grill pan over medium heat.
Remove the chicken from the marinade and pat it dry with paper towels. Discard the excess marinade.
In a small bowl, mix the salt, pepper, paprika, onion powder, and oregano. Season both sides of the chicken thighs with the seasoning mixture.
Add a little olive oil to the pan, then cook the chicken thighs for 6-7 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 165F (74C) and they are golden and caramelized.
Let the chicken rest for a few minutes.
Prepare the Bowls:
Divide the cooked rice among four bowls.
Top with fire-roasted corn, sliced cucumbers, and red onions (raw or pickled as preferred).
Add the sliced honey lime chicken thighs on top of the rice and veggies.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with lime wedges on the side for an extra zesty kick.

recipes.title: Beef short ribs parpadelle
ingredients: 5,369 likes, 44 comments - thehealthyboom on August 19, 2024: "Beef Short Rib Ragu - recipe Below - this is my ultimate comfort food. The dish i need the most at the end of a long week or if anything goes wrong in my life. Its a food-hug in a bowl. Let me know what you guys think of this one x JGS
steps: tbsp olive oil
kg beef short ribs
large onion, finely chopped
large carrot, finely chopped
sticks celery, finely chopped
cloves garlic, finely chopped
tbsp tomato puree
tsp smoked paprika
12 tsp dried thyme
tin chopped tomatoes
ml beef stock, with 1 cube
x 750ml bottle of red wine
g pappardelle (enough for 4 people) Parm to serve Salt and pepper

Heat the oil in a casserole over a high heat. Pat the short ribs dry and season all over with salt and pepper. Brown the ribs in two batches for 8-10 minutes, tuning every 2-3 minutes until golden. Remove from the pan.

Reduce the heat to medium. Chuck the onion, carrot and celery into the pan. Season with plenty of salt and pepper and mix well. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 8-10 minutes or until everything is soft.

Add the garlic to the pan. Mix well and cook, stirring occasionally, for a minute until fragrant. Then add the tomato puree, paprika, thyme, tomatoes, stock and red wine. Mix well and bring to the boil. Return the ribs to the pan. Cover, reduce the heat to low and cook for 3 12 - 4 hours or until the meat falls off the bone.
Remove the ribs from the sauce and leave to cool slightly. Remove and discard the fat, bone and sinew. Shred the meat and cover.

Meanwhile, leave the sauce, bubbling gently without the lid to reduce by half. It will take 50-60 minutes. Add the meat and mix well. Do a final seasoning check and you are done. Remove a third of the sauce for leftovers.
Cook the pasta until al dente in a large pan of boiling salted water. Drain and add to the ragu. Mix well and serve with plenty of Parm. Credit @johngs

recipes.title: Red wine braised short ribs
steps: Pat the short ribs dry, coat in olive oil and season generously on all sides with salt, pepper and garlic powder.
Get a large greased skillet going over medium high heat and sear the short ribs on all sides until you get a nice crust. Once done, set aside.

Get a dutch oven or any large oven-safe pan/pot going over medium heat. Add in some olive followed by your celery, carrots, onions and garlic. Season with salt and pepper then mix. Let saute for a few minutes then clear a spot in the middle and add in the tomato paste. Mix that in tell everything is well combined then place your short ribs on top. Pour in the wine and beef broth untill the liquid covering the top of the short ribs. Add in the thyme, rosemary and bay leaf. Place the lid on and pop it in the oven at 325 for 2.5-3 hours or until the short ribs are fall apart tender.
Once the short ribs are done, turn off the oven & leave them in there while you make the garlic-parm potato puree.

For the Potatoes:~1 lb. Yukon Gold Potatoes, peeled and cut in 1.5 chunks2 Tbsp Olive OilKosher Salt & Pepper

For the Chicken:3 Large Garlic Cloves, finely chopped1 Small Lemon, juice1/2 Cup Chicken Broth~15 Springs Fresh Thyme~2 lb. Bone-in Skin-on Chicken Thighs (or breasts cut in half, legs, etc.)Kosher Salt & Pepper2 Tbsp Olive Oil

2 Place the potatoes in a large baking dish (9x13 or similar) and toss with 2 Tbsp olive oil and a sprinkle of salt and pepper. Bake for 40 minutes. Remove from the oven and increase the temp to 425F.

3 Add the garlic, lemon juice, and chicken broth to the dish and mix with the potatoes. (Use a spatula to release the potatoes from the dish if they are sticking.) Space out the potatoes evenly and arrange the thyme sprigs on top.

4 Thoroughly dry the chicken with paper towels (the skin needs to be dry to crisp up), and season both sides generously with salt and pepper. Place the chicken skin side up in one layer on top of the potatoes and thyme and drizzle 2 Tbsp of olive oil on top of the chicken skin.

5 Bake at 425F for 35-40 mins until the chicken is golden brown and internal temp reaches 165F, then broil for 3-5 mins until the chicken skin is deep golden brown and crispy. (It can be helpful to move the chicken to the top rack when broiling, but watch it closely because things can burn easily.)
6 Let rest for couple of minutes, then squeeze on the juice of 1/2 a lemon and sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley. Serve the chicken and potatoes with gravy from the dish spooned on top and enjoy!
10 minute prep time + 1 hour 20 minute cook time
Recipe serves 3 people (you can increase the chicken and potatoes amounts if youd like to serve more)".

recipes.title: Pear puff pastry
steps: cinnamon sticks For the filling:
g chopped walnuts
g honey cinnamon Zest of orange
Prepare a spiced syrup by adding water, sugar, vanilla, lemon zest, cinnamon, and star anise to a pot. Bring to a boil.

Peel the pears, cut them in half, remove the cores, and place them in the boiling syrup. Cook for 10-15 minutes (depending on the initial firmness of the fruit). Test with a toothpick; if it goes in and out easily, the pears are done.
Carefully remove the pears and let them drain on paper towels.
Prepare a fine mixture of walnuts, honey, and grated orange zest, then fill the pears.

Cut the puff pastry into 6 rectangles and place a pear in the center of each. Make a light cut around the shape of the pear and brush with the syrup. If desired, add some sugar to make them even crunchier.
Bake at 180C (350F) for about 25 minutes, until cooked and golden brown.
Add a mint leaf and serve with a light dusting of powdered sugar. What other fruit could you make these with?

recipes.title: Creamy coconut noodle soup
ingredients: 331K likes, 1,022 comments - johngs on November 1, 2024: "Creamy coconut noodle soup  Recipe below  if you love a creamy coconut noodle soup, you are going to love this one. The best bit, the jammy eggs. My secret, use @freshlayfarmsgoldenyolker to get them perfect every time. They look dazzling and taste SO lush. Enjoy x JGS -ad-.
steps: tbsp red curry paste
tbsp peanut butter
cloves garlic, crushed
inch ginger, grated
ml coconut milk
ml chicken stock
stalk lemongrass
tbsp fish sauce The juice of a lime
frozen dumplings
Freshlay Farm Golden Yolkers at room temperature
handfuls of beansprouts A few coriander leaves Black sesame seeds to serve Chilli oil to serve

Chuck the red curry paste, peanut butter, garlic and ginger into a pan. Turn on a medium heat and give the spice paste a mix for 30 seconds to get some heat onto it. Add the coconut milk, stock, lemongrass, fish sauce and lime juice. Mix well and bring to the boil. Cover, reduce the heat to low and cook for 10 minutes for the flavours to develop.

Meanwhile, cook the Freshlay Farm Golden Yolkers until jammy. Get your water onto boil and then reduce to a simmer. Add the eggs and cook for 7 12 minutes. Plunge into iced water and eave to cool for 3 minutes. Peel and cut in half.

Increase the heat of the soup to a gentle bubble and pop in the dumplings. Cover and cook for 5-6 minutes or until they are floating. Add the udon noodles, cover and cook for 2-3 minutes until they have separated.

To serve, divide the noodles, dumplings and soup between two bowls. Top with beansprouts, coriander and those jammy Freshlay Farm Golden Yolkers. Sprinkle over some black sesame seeds and chilli oil and get slurping.

recipes.title: Slow roasted oxtail
ingredients: 150K likes, 1,550 comments - cheatmeats on October 14, 2024: "Slow Roasted Oxtail Recipe  This melt in your mouth beefy cut has an intense, rich flavour making it perfect for your next stew or slow cooker dinner. As the collagen breaks down during slow cooking it creates a mouthfeel and depth of flavor thats second to none! Written recipe below;
Season the oxtail with salt on all sides and then lightly dust with flour.
Add olive oil to a large casserole dish and set over high heat.
Brown off the oxtail and seal on all sides.
Deglaze the pan with white wine, then add 3-4 bay leaves, fresh thyme, 1 can of quality diced tomatoes and 1L beef stock.
Place the lid on the casserole dish and place in to a preheated oven set to 160C for 3 hours.
Remove the roast from the oven and add baby potatoes cut in half.
Place back in the oven and roast for a further 1.5-2 hours until the oxtail is tender.
Once the oxtail is nice and tender remove and allow to rest for 20 minutes.
Serve straight on the table with fresh thyme sprinkled over the top.

steps: Prepare the Fish:

Saute the Aromatics: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and saute for 3-4 minutes until softened. Add sliced chilies, turmeric powder, and ground coriander, stirring to coat the mixture.
Make the Curry Base: Pour in the coconut milk and water (or fish stock). Stir well to combine. Add fish sauce, sugar (if using), kaffir lime leaves, and lime zest. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Cook the Fish:
Finish with Lime: Remove from heat and stir in lime juice. Adjust seasoning with more fish sauce or lime juice to taste.

Serve: Ladle the curry into bowls and garnish with fresh cilantro, sliced red chili, and lime wedges. Serve hot with steamed jasmine rice or coconut rice. Chefs Tips Fish Options: Use firm white fish like halibut or monkfish to prevent breaking apart in the curry. Extra Heat: Add a teaspoon of red curry paste for more spice".

recipes.title: Banana Bread
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a 9x5-inch loaf pan with parchment.
Whisk together mashed bananas, eggs, brown sugar, melted butter, yogurt, and vanilla until smooth.
In a separate bowl combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon.
Fold dry ingredients into the banana mixture until just combined.
Stir in walnuts and chocolate chips, reserving a few for topping.
Transfer batter to the prepared pan, smooth the top, and sprinkle with reserved mix-ins.
Bake 55-60 minutes until a tester inserted in the center comes out clean, then cool on a rack before slicing.

steps: Cut out the core of the cabbage. Place the whole cabbage in a large pot of boiling water. Using tongs, carefully peel away the leaves as they loosen. Cut out the tough stem from each leaf and set aside.

Mince any cabbage leaves that are too small for rolling. Saute the onion and mushrooms until soft, then season with salt and pepper. Mix the onion/mushroom mixture with the veggie mince and minced cabbage. Depending on your mince, you may want to add an egg for binding. Season with salt and pepper.
Place about 2 tablespoons of the filling in the center of each cabbage leaf. Fold the sides inward, then roll into a log. The rolls dont need to be fully sealed.
Fry the cabbage rolls in olive oil on the pretty side for about 2 minutes, until golden brown. Transfer to a baking dish, brush the top with maple Sirup or treacle and bake at 180C for 15 minutes.
Dissolve the jelly cubes in 600ml of hot cabbage cooking water. After the cabbage rolls have baked for 15 minutes, add the stock to the dish and continue baking for another 15-20 minutes.
(Optional) Pour the stock into a small pot and thicken with a cornstarch slurry (1 teaspoon cornstarch mixed with 1 tablespoon of stock) if youd like a gravy.
Serve with lingonberries, cucumber salad, and potatoes if desired.

steps: g smoked salmon
g creme fraiche
tsp fresh dill
tbsp lemon juice
tsp lemon zest

/4 tsp salt Preheat your oven to 230C (445F) and place your cast iron pan on the middle shelf. Make sure theres enough space above it for your Dutch Baby to expand. In a stick blender jug add the eggs, flour, milk & salt. Blend until smooth and aerated. This can also be done in a stand up blender. Grate the parmesan, chop the herbs fine and mince the garlic. Transfer to a bowl. I like to add a pinch of salt to this mixture also. When youre ready to go, remove the pan from the oven and add the butter. Let it bubble and melt down completely. To serve In a bowl mix the creme fraiche, chopped dill, lemon juice, lemon zest and salt. Arrange the smoked salmon in the bottom of the Dutch Baby and spoon over the dill creme fraiche. recipes.title: Swiss croissant bake
steps: Preheat oven to 350F (175C) and grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.

steps: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with aluminum foil and lightly spray with cooking spray.
Peel shrimp, leaving tails intact.
Use a paring knife to cut lengthwise down vein side of shrimp, cutting almost but not all the way through the shrimp. Remove the vein and gently press shrimp apart to butterfly it.

Combine shrimp, wine, olive oil, oregano, 1 tablespoon parsley, 1 tablespoon garlic, 1 teaspoon lemon zest, and 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper, and salt in a bowl; toss to coat shrimp evenly. Let stand at room temperature for at least 10 minutes.

Meanwhile, combine panko, Parmesan cheese, 2 tablespoons melted butter, and remaining 1 tablespoon parsley, 1 tablespoon garlic, 1 teaspoon lemon zest, and 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper in a small bowl; stir until well blended. : Karen Rankin : @nicolemcmom

recipes.title: Crme caramel
steps: g sugar
Pour the milk and the vanilla bean (previously split in half) into a saucepan.
Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Let it cool slightly.
In a large bowl, combine the eggs and sugar, mixing with a hand whisk until combined. No need to incorporate air.
Remove the vanilla bean from the now lukewarm milk, and add the fresh cream.
Add the milk to the egg and sugar mixture, stirring again until you get a smooth cream.
Prepare the caramel by heating the sugar in a small pan without stirring, just rotating the pan.
When the caramel turns amber, pour it into 6 molds placed in a baking dish, covering their base.
Add the cream mixture to fill the molds.
Pour boiling water into the baking dish until it covers one-third of the molds.
Bake at 180C for about 50 minutes. Will you try it?

recipes.title: Kue dads
ingredients: Heat a 22cm-ish non-stick frypan over a medium-low heat. Grease ever so lightly with a paper towel dipped in vegetable oil. Pour about 1/4 cup of batter into the frypan and swirl around until the base of the pan is coated. Cook until the surface of the crepe is dry to touch. Release the edge with a butter knife, hold the edge with both sets of fingers, peel carefully back &  flip over to cook for a few seconds before piling onto a plate with the 1st cooked side facing down. The crepe should be cooked through but not caramelised so the green of the pandan stays a vibrant green.

To assemble place a dessert spoon full of the filling onto a crepe & roll into a cigar (see reel). Repeat until all the crepes or filling are used up. Serve at room temp. These will keep for 1 day unfridged. If chilled, allow to come to room temp or microwave for a few seconds until tepid. Enjoy!".

steps: Place the beef short ribs in a pot and add enough cold water to cover them by 1 inch. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and cook for 3 minutes.

Add the chestnuts, shiitake mushrooms, carrots, and Korean radish. Bring to a boil again, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for another hour, stirring occasionally.

ingredients: 72K likes, 237 comments - gilliehouston on October 20, 2024: "Short rib sundays
steps: bone-in beef short ribs Salt and pepper Olive oil
medium white onion, diced
medium carrots, peeled and diced
large garlic cloves, smashed
/2 cup dry red wine
tablespoon balsamic vinegar
tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
tablespoon light brown sugar
cups beef stock
dried bay leaves

sprigs of rosemary Preheat the oven to 300F. Season the short ribs all over with salt and pepper. Add a thin layer of olive oil to the bottom of a Dutch oven or large oven-sage pot and heat over high heat. When the olive oil is shimmering add the short ribs to the pan and sear until crispy and browned on all sides, about 3 minutes per side. Remove the short ribs from the pot and transfer to a wire rack. Add the balsamic, Worcestershire sauce, and brown sugar to the pot, and stir until the brown sugar has melted into the vegetables. Add the beef stock and bay leaves to the pot. Remove the pot from the oven and discard the bones and bay leaves. Serve the short ribs whole with the juices poured over top, or shred the meat into the juices for a more stew-like consistency.

lemon, sliced
lemons, juiced
cloves garlic, minced or thinly sliced 13 cup plus 2 tbsp olive oil

3 cups chicken bone broth Salt and pepper, to taste Preheat oven to 350F. Combine juice of two lemons with garlic, 13 cup olive oil and a few pinches of salt in a measuring cup and whisk well to combine. Season chicken generously with salt and pepper. Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a braiser or dutch oven over medium high heat. Add chicken to hot oil skin side down and sear until golden brown, about 7-8 minutes. Remove from dutch oven and set aside. Deglaze pot with 2 cups of bone broth, scraping the bottom of the pot to release anything that has stuck. Add in potatoes then place chicken on top of and around potatoes, wedging it all into a single layer as much as possible. Pour lemon sauce over top then add fresh herbs and lemon slices all around.

recipes.title: One pan lemony chicken bake
ingredients: 2 pounds bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs3 tbsp olive oilSalt & pep1 shallot, minced3 tbsp fresh dill, finely chopped5 garlic cloves, minced1 tsp lemon zest2 tbsp Dijon mustard1/4cup grated pecorino2 lemons
2 tbsp parsley, chopped (for garnish)4 lemon wedges (for garnish)
steps: Preheat oven to 425F.
Pat the chicken dry and place in a baking dish.
Massage with 2 tbsp olive oil, season with salt + pepper.
Add shallot, dill, garlic, lemon zest, mustard, pecorino, and 4 tbsp lemon juice.
Rub everything into the chicken. Let sit for 30 mins to 2 hrs if possible.
Pour the remaining 2 tbsp lemon juice over the top + drizzle with the last tbsp of olive oil.
Bake for 30-35 mins. Baste with pan juices, then bake 10-15 more until golden and cooked through.
Spoon the drippings over the top, garnish with parsley + lemon wedges, and serve!

ingredients: 5,819 likes, 42 comments - nytcooking on May 29, 2025: "Heres how to make @clarkbars Spaghetti With Garlicky Bread Crumbs and Anchovies:
13 cup extra-virgin olive oil, more as needed
Black pepper and kosher salt, as needed
1 teaspoon hot sauce, such as Tabasco, or to taste

In a medium skillet over medium-high heat, warm oil. Add anchovies, garlic and red pepper flakes; cook until fragrant, 1 minute. Stir in bread crumbs and cook until golden, 2 to 3 minutes. Season liberally with black pepper, and a little salt if needed.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook according to package instructions; drain well, reserving some of the pasta water (about 12 cup is plenty).

In a large, preferably warmed bowl, stir together egg yolks, fish sauce, hot sauce and 2 tablespoons pasta water. Add hot pasta and toss well, adding more pasta water if the mixture looks dry or unevenly yellow. You want the yolk to evenly coat the pasta but you dont want it to be soupy. Add bread crumb mixture and parsley and toss well. Season with plenty of black pepper, and salt to taste. Drizzle pasta with more oil just before serving and serve with lemon wedges.".

recipes.title: Chicken with leaks and butter beans
steps: tbsp capers
/2-1 garlic clove dash of cider vinegar squeeze of lemon olive oil salt
Fry the chicken breasts skin side down in a little oil until golden and remove from the pan.
Add the leeks to the pan and soften, add the garlic and a couple of minutes later the butter beans, miso and 300ml stock.
Stir well and nestle the chicken back in with the skin poking out. Simmer for about 6-8 mins until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened a bit.
Rest the breast for a couple of minutes and slice.
For the salsa verde finely dice the parsley and capers, grate the garlic and mix together with the vinegar, lemon juice, a pinch of salt and enough olive oil so it pours off a spoon.
Serve the beans in a shallow bowl, top with the chicken and drizzle over the salsa verde.

recipes.title: Crispy chicken with butterbeans and leeks
ingredients: 1 stock cube dissolved in 100ml boiling water
steps: Preheat the oven to 200C (fan).

Heat a glug of olive oil in an ovenproof casserole or frying pan. Place the chicken in the pan skin side down and cook for about 5 minutes until the skin is crisp. Turn and cook on the second side for about 1 minute to seal, then transfer to a plate.
Add the diced leeks to the rendered chicken fat and cook until soft, about 3 to 4 minutes.
Stir in the butter beans, prepared stock, and white wine. Bring everything to a simmer.
Add the spinach, cover for a few minutes to wilt, then stir in the basil leaves.
Return the chicken to the pan skin side up, drizzle with a little more olive oil, season the skin with flaky salt, and bake for 25 minutes.
